Articles.Content:
I've been running 1.12 using CKAN - used it to install as many mods as possible including Tweakscale. Today, when I try to launch KSP I get an error that Interstellar Redist.dll must be in the GameData folder, but when I move it there, I get an error that Tweakscale can't find the required .dlls. Both errors are showing up as show-stopper errors (the dreaded "Houston, we have a problem" message on the splash screen).

I've uninstalled and re-installed using both CKAN and manually, following the directions in the install file. I've downloaded Tweakscale from both CurseForge and Spacedock. 

In the interest of full disclosure, when I first opened CKAN today, it prompted me to update one of the installed mods, which I did before launching KSP and starting to get these errors.  I'm fairly certain it was ZeroMiniAVC, and I tried uninstalling it but there was no change. Yeah, I know: sucks to be me.

Any possible suggestions will be welcome.  

Edited October 19, 2021 by maddog59

Hey, I just met with the same problem with you and I solved it by sequences as follows:

1): delete all AVC addon mods

2): find all .dll files with 'redist' in name, in my case it is in the Infernal robotics mod and I delete this .dll file

3): at this time the pop-up error messages should disappear. if something like modulemanager error shows when loading games, try reinstalling the tweakscale mod without the 'extra' file in it.

Hope this can help you.

@AkatsukiMana Thanks, but unfortunately those suggestions haven't worked for me. I've created a new KSP directory and am in the process of re-adding all of my mods, a few a time. Maybe I can figure out how to get around the problem... Much obliged!

I've rebuilt my KSP folder from scratch, added in all of the mods I wanted, but when I try to run KSP with Tweakscale installed I get a fatal error message along the lines of 'Tweakscale couldn't find the needed DLLs', and that "Type initializer for KSPe.IO.Heirarch'1' threw an exception".  I've listed my mods and versions below (per KSP-AVC); note that I have TweakableEverything installed, but although KSP runs correctly, the scaling widget doesn't appear on any of my parts. I tried unloading TweakableEverything  and just using Tweakscale, but still got the same error.

Is there anyone who can explain what the problem is? 

KSP: 1.12.2 (Win64) - Unity: 2019.4.18f1 - OS: Windows 10  (10.0.0) 64bit

ClickThroughBlocker - 0.1.10.17

Edited October 24, 2021 by maddog59
additional info
Mine is throwing the same error code too. cant find out why.
I've got the same problem - sorry I can't be of any help.

On 10/21/2021 at 7:37 PM, AkatsukiMana said:

Hey, I just met with the same problem with you and I solved it by sequences as follows:

1): delete all AVC addon mods

2): find all .dll files with 'redist' in name, in my case it is in the Infernal robotics mod and I delete this .dll file

3): at this time the pop-up error messages should disappear. if something like modulemanager error shows when loading games, try reinstalling the tweakscale mod without the 'extra' file in it.

Hope this can help you.

Thanks a lot, Exactly this worked for me, just remember to delete Zero Mini AVC too

On 10/21/2021 at 10:37 AM, AkatsukiMana said:

Hey, I just met with the same problem with you and I solved it by sequences as follows:

1): delete all AVC addon mods

2): find all .dll files with 'redist' in name, in my case it is in the Infernal robotics mod and I delete this .dll file

3): at this time the pop-up error messages should disappear. if something like modulemanager error shows when loading games, try reinstalling the tweakscale mod without the 'extra' file in it.

Hope this can help you.

when i do this, the only dll file with redist is the one that makes tweakscale work

I was having the same problem as you. It prompted me to download something called Recall here: https://github.com/net-lisias-ksp/KSP-Recall/releases. Once I downloaded the Curse Forge version and took the folder "999_KSP-Recall" out of "KSP-Recall-0.3.0.1-Curse Forge", It worked.

Unfortunately those three steps don't work for me as zero miniAVC is required by multiple other mods and the curseforge solution simply didn't work. Does anyone else have another solution? I know this mod combination worked at another point in time. The only thing that has really changed is the mod version.
i deleted the infernal robotics .ddl file, it still wont work. any ideas?

4 hours ago, hellothere___ said:

i deleted the infernal robotics .ddl file, it still wont work. any ideas?

Posting the KSP.log so people can inspect it will surely help!

Created this account just to say that I just had the same problem and the listed solutions did not work. I eventually discovered that the Trajectories mod was in conflict somehow, and uninstalling that fixed it.

18 hours ago, GalaxyStuff said:

Created this account just to say that I just had the same problem and the listed solutions did not work. I eventually discovered that the Trajectories mod was in conflict somehow, and uninstalling that fixed it. 

Interesting... can you do us a favor? Install it back, reproduce the problem, quit KSP and publish the KSP.log? It can be some interaction with another add'on instead of being something on it!

Cheers!

On 10/14/2023 at 3:10 PM, Lisias said:

Posting the KSP.log so people can inspect it will surely help!

never mind, my bd anim module was outdated. sorry for the trouble
